qas.question: Youtube depends on who to flag inappropriate videos?
Who checks the flagged videos for unauthorized content?
The United Kingdom stated it was what with youtube's policies with moderating its content?
When did the UK speak out against youtube's copyright policies?
Who of the house of commons spoke out on youtube's policies?

plausible_answers.text: the content of videos as inappropriate

qas.question: What do uses rely on YouTube to flag?

plausible_answers.text: the Culture and Media Committee of the House of Commons of the United Kingdom

qas.question: Who said they were impressed in 2008?

plausible_answers.text: proactive review of content should be standard practice for sites hosting user-generated content

qas.question: What did the Media and Culture Committee of the House of Commons of the UK argue?

context: YouTube relies on its <a0_0>users<a0_0/> to flag <b5_0>the content of videos as inappropriate<b5_0/>, and <a1_0>a YouTube employee<a1_0/> will view a flagged video to determine whether it violates the site's terms of service. <a3_0>In July 2008<a3_0/>, <a4_0><b6_0>the Culture and Media Committee<a4_0/> of the House of Commons of the United Kingdom<b6_0/> stated that it was "<a2_0>unimpressed<a2_0/>" with YouTube's system for policing its videos, and argued that "<b7_0>proactive review of content should be standard practice for sites hosting user-generated content<b7_0/>". YouTube responded by stating:
